name: Shreddable Vegan Mozzarella
description: Vegan Mozzarella that can be shredded or sliced! It melts and stretches beautifully just like the real thing and only takes minutes to make!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup raw cashews (OR 1/2 cup silken tofu)
4 tablespoons tapioca starch ((also called tapioca flour))
4 tablespoons  refined coconut oil  ((make sure it's refined for no coconut flavor!))
1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, or more lemon juice

recipeInstructions.text: Bring 2 cups of water to a boil (I use my electric kettle.) Pour the hot water over the cashews and let soak for 5 minutes, then drain the cashews and discard the soaking water. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring 2 cups of water to a boil (I use my electric kettle.) Pour the hot water over the cashews and let soak for 5 minutes, then drain the cashews and discard the soaking water. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Get out a clean container that can hold about 3 cups. I prefer glass, but plastic will work. Have it ready before you start because you will need to move quickly once the cheese is blended.
recipeInstructions.name: Get out a clean container that can hold about 3 cups. I prefer glass, but plastic will work. Have it ready before you start because you will need to move quickly once the cheese is blended.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat up the 1 1/2 cups of water. It will need to be boiling when you add it to the blender. Again, I heat up water in my tea kettle, then measure 1 1/2 cups when I'm ready. You can also simply get it boiling in a small pan on the stovetop.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat up the 1 1/2 cups of water. It will need to be boiling when you add it to the blender. Again, I heat up water in my tea kettle, then measure 1 1/2 cups when I'm ready. You can also simply get it boiling in a small pan on the stovetop.

recipeInstructions.text: To a high powered blender (if you use tofu instead you can use a regular blender), add the soaked and drained cashews, tapioca starch, kappa carrageenan, nutritional yeast, salt, coconut oil, lemon juice and apple cider vinegar.
recipeInstructions.name: To a high powered blender (if you use tofu instead you can use a regular blender), add the soaked and drained cashews, tapioca starch, kappa carrageenan, nutritional yeast, salt, coconut oil, lemon juice and apple cider vinegar.

recipeInstructions.text: CAREFULLY pour in the boiling hot water, and immediately put the lid on and blend. Use a towel for extra protection so the hot water does not burn you! Blend until smooth, stopping to scrape down once if needed. It will only take a minute or so, and the mixture will start to harden fast so you need to work quickly.
recipeInstructions.name: CAREFULLY pour in the boiling hot water, and immediately put the lid on and blend. Use a towel for extra protection so the hot water does not burn you! Blend until smooth, stopping to scrape down once if needed. It will only take a minute or so, and the mixture will start to harden fast so you need to work quickly.

recipeInstructions.text: Immediately pour the cheese into your prepared container. It will start to harden super fast, so do not wait.
recipeInstructions.name: Immediately pour the cheese into your prepared container. It will start to harden super fast, so do not wait.

recipeInstructions.text: Move the container to the refrigerator, uncovered and let chill for 1-2 hours, until solid throughout and cooled.
recipeInstructions.name: Move the container to the refrigerator, uncovered and let chill for 1-2 hours, until solid throughout and cooled.

recipeInstructions.text: After a few hours, pop it out of the container, and either slice/shred right away or wrap in paper towels, then place in a large ziplock bag or container. This will help it be drier, which I think makes it better.

recipeInstructions.text: Use anywhere you would real mozzarella, such as on pizza, grilled cheese, cold sandwiches, pasta dishes, Mexican dishes, on top of soups or just for snacking.
